intro: Impatiens huangyanensis subsp. attenuata, commonly known as the Huangyan slender touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to white. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated, narrow leaves and reduced floral structures compared to other members of the species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
